content.content: MIP39c3-SP1: Core Unit Offboarding (SF-001)  Preamble MIP39c3-SP#: 1 Author(s): Deimos Contributors: Tags: core unit, cu-sf-001, mandate Status: RFC Date Applied: 2022-08-10 Date Ratified:  Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip39c5-spxx-core-unit-offboarding-sf-001/17134 Ratification Poll URL:   Sentence Summary This subproposal is to offboard the Strategic Finance Core Unit (SF-001).  Paragraph Summary [TBD]  Specification  Motivation SF-001 became increasingly more expensive without showing much value. A blurry mandate produces experiments that can be waste of time and risky projects.  "We’re building something here, Detective. We’re buildingit from scratch. All the pieces matter.” — Det. Lester Freamon   Too Expensive in Times of Crisis They advocate for bear market strategy and ask for cash like Cutty:   Latest DAI increase : ≈+32%  MKR repricing : ≈+270%  SF-001 is supposed to be exemplary, yet their MKR policy is the worst of all the CUs: no cap, no limit, 2-month average only.  Lack of Professionalism / Misuse of Funds The examples of their members behaving in bad faith (always with “data” that would make a conspiracy theorist blush) are everywhere in the forum. Misuse of funds: In tradfi, using company funds granted for CU operations to buy shares will land you in jail — in Maker it’s all good, it seems.  Lack of Results Things SF-001 did lately:  MIP40 amendment that changes dates to fit its own cycle. KPI suggestion. Lots of forum posting: Compared to other CUs, all the members hardly have time to do work. Lots of politics: @madshills confronted them and asked if the CU position was the official position since all the team was doing politics all the time.  Open source model. This is accountantspeak for a simple public spreadsheet. Lack of OKRs   Conclusion @aes alone was doing the same (productive) work before this CU became expensive. Now their updates look like GovComms’, with no concrete result.  Core Unit ID SF-001
content.GPT-summary: The post is a proposal to offboard the Strategic Finance Core Unit (SF-001) due to its increasing expenses without showing much value, lack of professionalism, misuse of funds, and lack of results. The proposal explains the motivation behind the decision and provides examples to support it. The post also includes the Core Unit ID and relevant dates. A 3rd party gives entirely negative feedback on the proposal, providing constructive criticism and auditing the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
None

content.content: This is a summary of the potential impact of this proposal, from GovAlpha’s perspective:  This is a valid offboarding proposal under the currently approved governance process  The Facilitator offboarding, budget modification, and Core Unit offboarding subproposals aim to offboard the Strategic Finance Core Unit (SF-001). If the offboarding proposal is ratified, the existing DAI and MKR vesting streams will be cancelled. This proposal asks the Community or SF-001 CU to propose an adequate severance plan for the contributors. No execution plan is provided. This proposal has been assigned High-Impact based on the methodology listed here.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely negative feedback on proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party auditing and reviewing proposal

content.content: Reminder that this proposal will enter its Frozen Period in one week, on Thursday September 1st at 00:00UTC. Substantive modifications beyond that time will render the proposal ineligible for the upcoming Governance Cycle / reset its Frozen Period, as the case may be.

content.content: This is absurd and completely flew under the radar for ACREinvest until today’s G&R call. I mean, it is absolutely laughable. The quality of this team is next level and the information provided on a regular basis is mission critical. I’m frankly stunned no one has commented or engaged with this post. There has been no conversation that caught my attention in various Discord channels or other forum posts. I’m just gobsmacked.  Without @strat-fin-core-unit, can you even MakerDAO bro?

content.content: Just posting to echo @ACREinvest and confirm that I see this proposal as a joke (or to be more accurate, a bit of trolling to waste everyone else’s time). SF are a fantastic team and the role they play at Maker is extremely important. I certainly do not believe they have acted in bad faith and there is no question in my mind that offboarding them would be an act of institutional self-sabotage.     ACREinvest:  I’m frankly stunned no one has commented or engaged with this post   Fair enough, but my inclination when originally seeing this post was to avoid ‘feeding the trolls’. I can understand that the silence greeting this post could be mistaken for ambivalence, though, hence my comment now.

3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None

content.content: We definitely have a bigger governance problem to fix if something like this can just go onchain for a vote with no other requirements. I’m generally of the view that we need a little more friction on what can come up for a vote. I get it goes against total openness and permissionlessness, but at this stage of organizational maturity and value at risk - I would favor adding a requirement that certain proposals require sponsorship by a delegate or CU facilitator. I also liked the suggestion in the G&R chat that failure for a proposer to organize an AMA it should not be able to proceed to vote.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party auditing and reviewing proposal

content.content: FYI, by design anyone can propose a vote on-chain. There is exactly zero gatekeeping. What you see on the gov portal is just a curated list of on-chain proposals, and those follow the processes outlined on those forums. But it’s worth thinking through who you’d give the authority to actually gatekeep proposing new votes.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely negative feedback on proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: swakya:  by design anyone can propose a vote on-chain. There is exactly zero gatekeeping.   Yes, I know. Thus my post. Some gates are useful. Gate keepers exist all throughout the organization - this could more benignly be referred to as “leaders” “facilitators” “recognized delegates”… basically anyone who has earned a position of trust in the community and been granted certain responsibilities or privileges - these are the “keepers” of that trust. We should utilize them as a filter for reducing governance spam and distractions.

content.content: Hey @Deimos, Our @MIP-Editors have reached out about some suggested edits. If you intend to have this go up for vote on Monday please reach out to them ASAP so we can process the proposals for vote. At this point it’s looking unlikely that they will be eligible, but we do have a bit more time to come to an agreement if you wish to see this measure proceed in the September cycle. I might humbly request considering holding off on submission until the October cycle, but if you get in touch we will make our best efforts to honor your desires.
